name: Secrets Wild Orchid Montego Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an AMAZING stay!!! My husband and I just returned last night from a 4 night stay at Wild Orchid and had a BLAST!!!! As if the resort wasn't beautiful enough, the people were even better! Their entire staff was OVERLY accomodating and thrilled to pamper you every minute of the day. We had an early checkin (10 AM) and upon entering the Preferred Club, we were greated with cool towels, a drink and delicious snacks. Our room was ready upon arrival (I couldn't believe it!) and within 30 minutes of settling and changing, my husband and I were poolside under the gorgeous sun!!
reviews.title: Secrets Wild Orchid...YEAH MON!!!

reviews.text: I enjoyed the preferred club and would spend the extra fees when I return. Having snacks, drinks, and free internet 24 hours was just perfect. This was a MUCH needed R&R trip and that's just what we got with the preferred club. We left our phones and computers so it was good to be able to send a quick email home letting our families know we were okay.
reviews.title: Beautiful
Trip Cancelled - here's why...
reviews.text: The restaurants have DELICIOUS food!!! I don't know where everyone else was staying but the food was GREAT!!! I guess earlier in the opening the food variety/quality may not have been so great but while we were there, it was quite enjoyable. Breakfast was a wonderful buffet (I'm missing it right now! LOL)!! Jerk chicken on the beach EVERY afternoon is a MUST!!!! I also loved the decor in every restaurant. Great design!

reviews.title: Beautiful resort, had a great time
reviews.text: The maid service was phenonemal. We always had enough towels and turn down service was equally perfect. Room service was no more than 30 minutes. There was two hours of rain the whole time we were there and my hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed it! It's really much needed to cool off! You MUST constantly apply sun block as those rays are piercing!!!

reviews.text: Our trip did not start off well. We booked a Wild Orchid PC Swim Out suite which was not available when we checked in. We were offered a free 6 day stay next year, nothing in writing, for our troubles. We were eventually moved to a swim out the next day after complaining which probably messed up someone else's expectation and was given a complimentary couples massage. Honestly, I think I liked the view from a balcony suite than the swim out.
reviews.title: Not Bad but Would Not Go Back

reviews.text: Very Narrow and very rocky in most parts. The water is opaque and a little cloudy from the man made beach and/or the limestone rocks they put in the water to help break up the waves. Always seemed to be able to find a lounge chair which was nice. Drink service very sporadic to non-existant at the beach. Snorkeling was good once you find your way out past those big rocks they put in. Swim 150-200 yds out in front of St James and there are some very large coral formations with lots of fish.

reviews.title: Soon to be a 5 star
Gorgeous Resort! Loved It!
reviews.text: I would like to preface this with my last travel experiences. Within the last 5 years I have stayed at Sandals Cuba, Sandals St Lucia, Secrets Punta Cana, Excellence Punta Cana and a Caribbean cruise with Royal Caribbean. The following our my observations and opinions compared to where I stayed before as mentioned above. I have only one complaint about the resort since it has just opened and that will be made quite clear.

We booked our vacation in March 2010 for the Preferred Club at St. James (Preferred Club is an additional charge compared to the regular rooms). At the beginning of May my travel agent advised us that we would be moved from St. James Preferred Club to Wild Orchid Preferred Club. This was due to the fact that St. James was not up to the standards of a 5 star resort as per West Jet. West Jet Vacations then made arrangements for their people to be transferred to Wild Orchid and a letter was sent to us indicating this change.
reviews.title: Anything for the Guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife then email Caulette (Concierge Manager) for verification of this and was told that Wild Orchid was an upgrade from St. James. Based on this we decided to go to Wild Orchid.
reviews.title: This is not a five star establishment

reviews.text: On the West Jet flight immigration cards were distributed through out the plane one per family. In the row behind us was a couple who was in Jamaica 6 weeks ago and advised the Flight Attendant that it is one form per person. The flight attendant seems to get upset with this information and told the couple that they were told one per family. My wife and I decided to ask for another card and good thing because the couple was right. The rest of the plane had to stand back and fill out additional forms.
reviews.title: Great location but Resort was just ok

reviews.text: So we read all the reviews and are glad we didn't pay attention. The location was beautiful, the staff was as friendly as could be, the food was great, and the rooms were perfect. The restaurants get a little warm, but it's a work in progress. They've only been open for 3 months, give em a break. My wife and I were there on our Honeymoon and are already planning a trip back. Make sure to see Donna at the pool bar, Dane at the W.O. lounge bar, and Althia for entertainment. I would also like to thank Althia for helping me find my wedding ring which flew off during volleyball.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my first time staying at a brand new resort. If I could do it over again, I would have gone somewhere else. While it was a nice vacation, I prefer "amazing" vacations. I work really hard and while I love to travel, I only get a couple of weeks away per year. I don't want to settle for nice. I wish I had gone to Secrets in Mexico to get a sense as to what Secrets Resorts are all about. I read every review and followed this resort on Facebook for weeks before our vacation, so I know how important these reviews are to those that are planning their vacations. These are my honest thoughts about this property: The staff tried VERY hard. Most provided excellent service: Terese our room attendant was great. Carl our lifeguard and pool attendant was AMAZING!! He took care of us everyday and went above and beyond to make our vacation special. The restaurants were fine and we like them in this order: (Best to worse): French, Italian, Jamaican and then Japansese. The server in the Japanese was great, but the food was awful. French--server was awful, but food was good. And therein lies the problem overall: consistency. Lunch buffet was great, but sit down restaurants were terrible (both service and food). Breakfast was great. Claudette is the best omelet maker ever. Loved her spirit, passion and dedication. Grounds need work . We love tropical and lush and it's just too new for that. Room was nicely appointed, but we lost power one night. No olives for the martinis, no lemons and limes for the drinks. Beach was nice, but it's man-made. Don't expect big palm trees and pathways lined with tropical plants. Bands at night were good. We enjoyed the piano bar and the outdoor entertainment. While we were there, there was a large conference held on property for the tourism board. The hotel staff just couldn't handle it. It was too early to do something like that at a hotel where it was a stretch to care for the guests they had. I had two spa treatments: a water lily wrap and a mini-facial. Both her awful. Rushed and not relaxing at all. Spa seemed medicinal, not welcoming and relaxing. Fitness Center is not air conditioned. So needless to say, it's disgustingly hot in there.
reviews.title: All inclusive, and it was! We had everything we needed and more.
